content.html:
Cool Down (5 minutes)

Student-Facing Statement

The function \(W\) gives the temperature, in degrees Fahrenheit, of a pot of water on a stove \(t\) minutes after the stove is turned on. After 30 minutes, the pot is taken off the stove.

The graph of the function is shown.

  1. Is 250 in the range of function \(W\)? Explain how you know.
  2. Describe the range of the function.
  3. Does \(W(t)=0\) have a solution? Explain how you know.

Student Response

  1. No, 250 is not in the range. The highest temperature is 212 degrees Fahrenheit.
  2. The range is all values between 75 and 212, the lowest and the highest temperature, \(75\leq y\leq212.\)
  3. No, a solution to this equation would be the time when the temperature is 0 degrees Fahrenheit, which is never the case.

Response to Student Thinking

More Chances

If students are still struggling with domain and range, examine errors in the cool-down and make sure to discuss domain and range during each of the activities in Lesson 13.
